text:
Hollywood star Brad Pitt showed up on “The Jim Jefferies Show” as a meteorologist, stating some discouraging news about President Donald Trump pulling out the United States of the Paris Climate Change Agreement.

All things considered, he came back to the show on Tuesday and said that the future remains very dark for all of us.

“Well, Jim, carbon dioxide is slowing turning our planet into an uninhabitable wasteland, and half the population don’t believe it,” he stated.

With respect to the weather this week, Pitt included, “The Lord saw the wickedness of man was great, and the Lord said, ‘I will destroy man, who I have created, from the face of the Earth.’ So don’t forget your sunscreen.”

The Hollywood star proceeded with stating “There is no future with this President.”

He added that with being raised up in Oklahoma, “which leans more toward a Trump voice,” he still tries to figure out the reasons that people have to support President Trump.

“Man, I never thought Brexit would happen. Same way I still can’t believe that Trump is in charge,” Pitt stated. “In the simplest terms, what brings us together is good, and what separates us is bad.”

“What I’m most hopeful about is that we’re a global neighborhood now, and we start to understand each other more and more — and yet, you see this reactionary push for isolation and separation again,” he added.

“A Trump supporter is fighting against just about everything. What does he even mean, take our country back?”

“Would someone please explain that to me? Where’d it go?”
